why: Baseline specification: basic controls (pop and black_share) with state FE and judicial division clustering
Baseline for white arrests placebo group - tests whether VRA affects white arrests (falsification)
Control progression: bivariate (no population control) - tests sensitivity to control inclusion
Control progression: basic controls - identical to baseline specification
Control progression: adds economic controls (education and unemployment)
Control progression: adds other controls (pro-black protests anti-black protests black police)
Control progression: full controls with coverage x control interactions (paper Table 1 column)
Control progression: extended adds lynching and NAACP controls
Control progression: kitchen sink adds KKK and additional lynching history
Control sensitivity: full controls minus education variable
Control sensitivity: full controls minus unemployment variable
Control sensitivity: full controls minus pro-black protest variable
Control sensitivity: full controls minus anti-black protest variable
Control sensitivity: full controls minus black police presence variable
Sample restriction: drops Texas - tests sensitivity to influential state
Sample restriction: drops Florida - tests sensitivity to influential state
Sample restriction: drops Mississippi - tests sensitivity to influential state
Sample restriction: drops Alabama - tests sensitivity to influential state
Sample restriction: drops Georgia - tests sensitivity to influential state
Covered counties only with different treatment variable (black_share60_proxy alone) - subgroup analysis changing both sample and treatment
Non-covered counties only with different treatment - subgroup with different treatment variable
Sample restriction: trimmed at 1-99 percentiles to remove outliers
Sample restriction: trimmed at 5-95 percentiles to remove outliers
Heterogeneity: high black share counties only (above median) - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: low black share counties only (below median) - subgroup analysis
White total arrests - different outcome testing different claim (placebo/falsification for G1)
Alternative outcome decomposition: Black felony arrests (same claim different outcome measure)
Alternative outcome decomposition: Black non-felony arrests (same claim different outcome measure)
White felony arrests - different outcome for white arrests placebo group
White non-felony arrests - different outcome for white arrests placebo group
Sheriff-only Black arrests - agency decomposition of main outcome (same claim different agency)
Police-only Black arrests - agency decomposition of main outcome (same claim different agency)
Sheriff-only White arrests - agency decomposition of white placebo
Police-only White arrests - agency decomposition of white placebo
Entirely different outcome: Black share of county governing body - tests political representation mechanism not arrest rates
Entirely different outcome: Black share of municipal government - tests political representation mechanism not arrest rates
Entirely different outcome: Black share of judges - tests political representation mechanism not arrest rates
Different treatment: VRA coverage indicator only (not interacted) - tests different causal channel
Different treatment: black_share60 only (not interacted) - tests different causal channel
Same treatment (interaction) but includes both main effects separately - control variation for proper interaction specification
Adds quadratic term in treatment - functional form test for nonlinearity
Inference variation: HC1 robust standard errors instead of clustered
Inference variation: clustering at state level instead of judicial divisions
Inference variation: classical (homoskedastic) standard errors
Inference variation: bootstrap standard errors (500 reps)
Inference variation: HC3 robust standard errors
Fixed effects variation: removes state fixed effects entirely
Estimation method: quantile (median) regression instead of OLS
Estimation method: WLS weighted by population instead of OLS
Functional form: uses raw count log difference instead of per-capita arrest rate difference
Functional form: adds quadratic terms in black share and interaction
Different treatment variable: log of treatment (covered counties only) - changes both treatment definition and sample
Placebo test: white arrests with full controls - should show no treatment effect
Placebo test: sheriff white arrests - should show no treatment effect
Duplicate of ln_diff_she_black spec - sheriff-only Black arrests agency decomposition
Placebo test: police white arrests - should show no treatment effect
Duplicate of ln_diff_pol_black spec - police-only Black arrests agency decomposition
Heterogeneity: Deep South states only (AL GA LA MS SC) - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: Upper South (non-Deep South) states only - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: counties with high unskilled share (>73.8%) - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: counties with low unskilled share (<=73.8%) - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: counties with pro-black protests only - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: counties with NAACP branch only - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: counties with black police in 1959 - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: counties without black police in 1959 - subgroup analysis
Heterogeneity: counties with KKK presence - subgroup analysis
